page.title: 17THE SEASONS IN GRAFTON
page.content: Last Winter was very cold with snow until March.All the roads were blocked and not cleared for a week and the School meals were unable to get through.Winter is the most common time for power shortages. Lambs are born in Spring and seeds are planted.Floods often occur and sometimes roads are blocked.The River Avon by the bridge at Welford usually floods at least once a year and the villagers have difficulty in getting to work In Summer temperatures reach 30 degrees celcius however the winds make it feel cool.Sometimes we have thunderstorms. In Autumn we dig up potatoes and harvest the corn with a combine harvester.A machine separates the ears from the stalk and the stalk is made into bales, then the stubble is burned. This can cause damage to the hedges.
